header: Delve usage reports (in O365 Admin center)
idea_text:
As an administrator I would like to view Delve usage reports (in O365 Admin center), so that I can understand if/how Delve is being used in my organization.Metrics of interest:
- Number of users per day (unique and total)
- Popular search queries inside Delve (by day/month)
- No result search queries inside Delve (by day/month)
- Abandoned sessions (user opens Delve, but does not click any cards or links)
- Web app vs. mobile app usage
- Most popular boards
- Unused boards
- etc.

comments.text: Please add this functionality!
Strongly agree with this suggestion, and other users keen to measure uptake in completion of profiles
YES! Essential part of measuring uptake, usage and interactions. Needed ASAP (please)
This is very much required.  However if the profile completion is available on the Delve page itself it can be a good indicator to the user as well

Adding to this suggestion: in addition to the above mentioned usage metrics, it would be great, if admins could see how many employees of a particular organization have filled in/updated their profiles. Updating one's profile is one of the first steps of Delve user adoption and would be a good indicator how many ppl have started using it. Would be great to see a sort "completion rate" per organization unit of a company.
Same request as Marisa K.

Adding to this suggestion: in addition to the above mentioned usage metrics, it would be great, if admins could see how many employees of a particular organization have filled in/updated their profiles. Updating one's profile is one of the first steps of Delve user adoption and would be a good indicator how many ppl have started using it. Would be great to see a sort "completion rate" per organization unit of a company.
Any news on this? Today it's impossible to know to what degree Delve is used in an organization.

header: Search through Delve (not SPO) skills and expertise, projects, ask me about and education
idea_text: Does Microsoft have the intent to enable searching for skills and expertise, projects, ask me about and education through Delve (not SPO)?

comments.text: This is must for us as well. Without search capability, the information has no value.

Totally agree here. I'd like to choose to search by either skills, experience, education, projects, or any combination of those. It would assist in collaboration if I could also restrict this search to specific groups (such as Yammer groups).
Agreed. This is a really needed feature.
I totally agree.  New users just expect to be able to search on information in Delve
agreed!! this creates more of a collaborative space

This is clearly a not only a must have but a simple miss.  All the user supplied Profile data should be searched by default in the system.  The whole idea of Delve is to connect you to People, Content and Experience.  Please get this this added right away.  It would also be handy to have LinkedIn support as well.
This is must for us as well. How useful is all the profile information if people can't easily access it through search?

This is huge for us too. We'd like our teams to be able to find internal SMEs directly from Delve (not the clunky SPO People Search page where you have to say "skills:<skill name"). It needs to be more native and intuitive. This is about connecting people across offices and work locations!

header: Support for customer refiners in modern search
idea_text: I work with a lot of customers that tag documents to improve findability. However, the modern search experiences do not (yet) support refining search results using business specific refiners (e.g. department, document type or location). As this is currently missing, some of my customers are reluctant to move to the modern experiences. It would seem logical to support this as it encourages people to tag documents. Without this, the use of metadata would be limited to "Highlighted content" web parts and list views.

comments.text: We at Mylan are facing the same issue , i think this should be a priority as custom search is required for every organization
Yes please, we have the same issue.
Absolutely needed.  This was available previously and was taken away from us
Business related refiners are a must to make the modern search results pages work.
Absolutely necessary to support search artefacts in modern sites including Refiners, Result sets, Display Templates, etc.
An great propposition! Ading refiners to your search is a great quick win to improve your search and gives users a solid example of what benefits you have for adding metadata
a very good idea, I have the same experience at my customers

header: Remove user from your Delve "people" list. Like you can "remove from list" in Office products

How'd it even happen? Well, I emailed the wrong person once, and that name has been there ever since.
If you want to make products that streamline office work, then please make them efficient. User should be able to arrange and delete names as needed.

My problem, and I can find it addressed nowhere else, is one contact has the wrong email account attached to their name. Their info needs to be corrected and I can't discover any way to do it.

One is the old users still show in Delve, despite all their account info (licenses, groups, etc..) being removed, so this would be nice to have for those issues. Second is that we can't always remove uses account info when they leave, but we would like to remove them from public directory lists, like Delve.
I wish we could delete people! It would make it so much easier!
I sure hope this SIMPLE feature gets added asap, thanks!
It is a pain in the proverbial back side PLEASE FIND SOLUTION TO REMOVE NAMES!!!
Needed since people come and go in organizations and those that have left stay in the list.

Other reasons: when moving department  or when changing projects. In both cases one can remain on the "old" access lists because they are badly maintained or even because one might need to give a hand to the old team (so needs access), but does not want to be troubled by updates in those teams.

header: Provide commenting, tagging, categorization, and organisation
idea_text: Currently there is no way to comment on the blogs, nor is there any way for the author to tag the blog with topics. Also needed is a way to be able to better organize all blogs based on topics/tags and date/month/year. Without this the new blog is no better than the older SharePoint based blogs, which at least have commenting, and archives to organanize.

header: Turn Off Delve Separately From Office Graph
idea_text: Currently it is only possible to turn off Delve by turning off Office Graph.  Please decouple Delve dependency from Office Graph so that Delve can be turned off independently of Office Graph.

comments.text: We understand very well that Delve does not change any security permissions and only shows documents that people already have access to.Regardless of the above, Delve is very unpopular with our users, privacy department and legal department. They simply do not want to show that view. So please provide an INDEPENDENT control to TURN OFF Delve without affecting any other functionality of O365 such as other functionality enabled by Office Graph.
legal request, required
+1 Turn Off Delve. Privacy Issues and potential GRDP violation!
My customer wants to turn off Delve but keep Office Graph and be also to use Graph APIs
+1 Turn Off Delve. Privacy Issues and potential GRDP violation!
Yes please. These 2 sections need to be independent of pone another, not interlinked.
Please give us the option to turn off delve for selected users while allowing Microsoft Graph to function

Turn off delve! What a terrible thing to have a system that automatically goes out and scours the sites for things that *might* be shared then delivers it on a silver platter to people. What a disaster! Terrible feature! Social networking garbage! This isint facebook! Stop adding in useless social features!
We cannot use Azure as it meant to be used because GRAPH API is blocked due to deactivation of Delve

please decouple Delve and Office Graph as Office Graph is so much more than Delve. We need it for SP, OneDrive, etc. Delve is a hot tpic with privacy, workers council and security and hence preventing us from turning on Office Graph!!

Need option to make Delve invisible for users individually or as a whole.We don't like the idea of people wasting time being nosy at what others are doing, and yes - it may be a permissions issue, but I NEED TO BE ABLE TO TURN OFF / HIDE DELVE WHILE I FIGURE IT OUT.
Turn Off Delve Separately From Office Graph  -  ASAP
Agree, give Admins MORE options not Less

header: Delve should have more explicit Managed Metadata support; Delve Board names should be linked to the Term Store
idea_text: Delve Board names should be linked to Managed Metadata Service.  Documents in SharePoint or One Drive that get tagged with the same term could be suggested for addition to the board.  People who have tagged themselves with that term (Project or expertise, etc) could have the board suggested to them, etc.  Topic is a very important signal and Delve should be using the term store to formalize its use.

comments.text:
Hi Mark, thank you so much for the insightful article! I am also convinced by the value Delve can generate for a company. 
I am currently working on this topic for my company and already associated the field "Skills" with a relevant Term Set. Now I would like to implement your points 3 and 4 so that my colleagues can see the possible tags and so that we can filter our colleagues using these skills. Can you tell me how I can set this up? Or do you know where I could find instructions? So far I could not find what I need. Thanks a lot.
This is a must have. Thanks for suggesting it, Mark.
I thought this would have been already leveraged? This is a must have for Graph and Delve.

Absolutely. We are preparing to migrate to O365, and the use of metadata to extract meaning is essential. The functionality within SharePoint search which allows the use of various metadata should be added to Delve.

Our hierarchical taxonomy has become an integral part of how we manage correspondence. We also use it (and other controlled lists) in Delve profiles. However, the means of accessing the terms in Delve isn't a good, intuitive experience for our users. We want to expand the use of the terms into other areas to help with electronic document and records management. Improved term store management, easier user interface and better connections between all elements of SPO would be welcome.
Agree!

I also completely agree with this assessment. Taxonomy surfacing is critical.
I developing an application for Office Dynamics 365 that can be employed by many different industries and skill sets.
I completely agree with this assessment.  Taxonomy surfacing is critical.
would be good to follow up on the topic.
I fully support this.Ellis
This would be a great idea.

Yes! To boost findability having a taxonomy behind the scenes to tie together the Microsoft collaboration suite is a must have!  Thanks!
Nathan
As a Corporate Librarian, I absolutely agree that expanding the metadata/taxonomy used in SharePoint to further linked applications would revolutionize digital asset management.
Agree. Also you need to add metadata to Exchange Online to allow people to tag emails. Not only would that greatly help search within EO, it could also flow through to Delve.
This idea is further fleshed out in my article at

header: Enable Delve for specific users/groups only
idea_text: Currently Delve can only be enabled/disabled on a tenant-wide basis. We would like the ability to enable Delve for specific users/groups only, to allow for a more phased introduction/rollout.

comments.text: legal request , required
If you don't make this available you loose the students part, by letting them go to GSuite. This is holding the whole Primary School market by using the tenant with both students and teachers.
I'm being asked for selective disabled of delve.
Schools may not want students to see all the contact details for staff, and vice versa. Some sort of control to be able to configure Delve to the requirements of customers would be appreciated
Needed to limit its use in certain countries where it is not approved

This is so critical, I cannot believe it's been two years and not yet implemented.  We were about to import our parent accounts into Azure AD before we realized that with absolutely NO Office 365 licensing, a parent could search Delve and find teacher contact details along with all sorts of student attributes.  We've avoided a huge data breach here...
Students and employees in the same tenant. Need to hide students personal information, but see all the advantages having one tenant. Teachers are both employees and have benefits from one tenant.
We have students and employees in the same tenant, need to hide the students personal information and documents from Delve and SP searches due to GDPR regulations!
We would like this feature so that we can test some impact or certain teams and employees before deploying en masse.
needs to allow more control to evaluate before rolling out to the users
Institutions of Higher Ed must have the ability to suppress individuals from appearing in searches and Delve.

Having an 'all or nothing' approach for Delve is counter productive. Graph behaves in a similar manner.Add granularity and allow the Admin's to delegate access. If this cannot be provided yet, then take it down until it is.GDPR will be active in approximately 6 months. It will come around fast

This has now become a absolute vital need for all organisations dealing with GDPR! We are trying to host site collections that includes external users. Through delve they search and find every single user in the whole Office 365 directory, getting the organisational structure and all the contact information of everyone up to CEO level.How are we suppose to motivate that these users have access to all this data - both to our organisation and to the EU?More granular controls for Delve is now a question of compliance with EU law.
need to phase the rollout
Needed to limit its use in certain countries where it is not approved
We need this feature to test out the functionality before we rollout

header: Ability to embed dynamic Delve Boards on SharePoint Pages as app or embed
idea_text: Create an app or embed function for every board for display on SharePages. Since boards are just an aggregated view of content, this would work similar to adding a list view to page, but obviously with more dynamic and visual content. Views should allow for auto scaling of the tiles based on area of the embedded cotent.

comments.text: Any update?

Any update?
Any update?

This can be created as an SPFx web part, but it would be great if Microsoft would give us one out of the box. As a configuration option, give us the ability to scope the Delve results. Return results from everything, certain sites, certain libraries, certain pages, etc etc. The more options the better.

In my environment I have an admin and his 2-3 executive assistants. The admin should be able to define his "board" categories and the exec assistants, acting as his proxy, should be able to tag documents with that board category. As it is now, there is no live link between the board and multiple users sharing that board tag. There should be definable proxy groups and all users within that group share the same board/tag structure.
Also the ability to embed the Delve blogs in SharePoint pages. That would be a really cool feature as otherwise Delve will create silos if people are just concentrating on either SP or Delve.
I am a Program Manager working on boards, and we are looking into how we tie this concept together with SharePoint so they do not exist in isolation in Delve. That's all I can share for now.

Access to a feature like this is important to us. We have users that need to see content that is tailored specifically to them, and that is pulled from all over the O365 platform. These users generally have a very limited knowledge of O365 and this would make it as simple as possible for them to use, while still reducing the risk of documents being duplicated or pulled from an incorrect location.
Also enable displaying boards on team site pages

Conversation thread - I think this is a great idea and it has my vote. Even if a Delve web part for SharePoint only serves to draw people to using Delve from within SharePoint, that would be an advantage.

This is really important to us.
Many of our clients are not yet ready to allow users to roam free amongst the wider office 365 applications. They want their SharePoint intranet to be the centre of activity rather than the currently fragmented office O365 components, so embedding Delve within their intranet rather than external to the intranet is really important and they're confused why they can't do that already

header: Add content to a Delve board from SharePoint or OneDrive
idea_text: How about adding board tagging to a document's source location like SharePoint or OneDrive? That way we wouldn't have to hope we find a document in the Delve application if we wanted to proactively add it to a board in Delve.

reaction.note: I will ask the SharePoint team to comment on this one, as I belive there may be some plans

comments.text: Couldn't agree more - why can't we have the option in OneDrive to add to a Board rather than have to search for it in Delve?
Came here hoping to find a way to do this. Cannot believe after several years that this functionality is still not there! Delve is pretty useless without it.

We've recently moved to SPoL and we're rolling out other aspects of the O365 suite such as Delve. Our user were really enthused with Delve and Delve Boards in particular but within hours of rollout users were asking for the ability to add to boards from SharePoint and from within the file itself. Delve needs this feature.
Still not available. :-(
Yes!  From SharePoint we should be able to assign a document to a Delve board either by using the context menu or 3 dots.

Delve is on the right track to becoming the product my company is desperately missing, but it's just not quite there. I need a "discovery dashboard" of sorts that is unique to each employee, but that contains elements that can be easily standardized across all employees. It needs to "surface" or "expose" all the bits of data being squirreled away in different SharePoint sites, Teams sites, and employee OneDrive folders. Being able to mass "pin" files, folders, links, etc. to boards in Delve from the source platform (OneDrive, SharePoint) would go a long way.Also, what about displaying team (as in MS Teams) File and Wiki data directly in delve as a board or simply a "Team" list in the left column?Since Teams, OneDrive, SharePoint, and Delve are all sharing the same back end storage (right? or do I misunderstand?) wouldn't it only make sense for Delve to have a view into all of these disparate storage paths? I mean the program is called Delve for crying out loud.Let me Delve into my data! Don't make me wait for it flash on my screen in Delve before I can do anything with it.

As has already been commented - without the ability to pin to Delve boards from across the breadth of the O365 estate Delve is of minimal use. The potential to support information management principles is huge. One source pinned many times is what we’re after surely. Currently my organisation only has pinning from OneDrive which promotes information stovepipes and bad information management practices - hard to fight ther good fight without the full capability!

I would love to see this feature as well.  The ability to "follow" documents is no longer in the modern view for libraries, so it is becoming harder for users to keep track of relevant documents.  Delve seems like the solution, but right now it is disjointed as some have pointed out, since you have to surface the document in Delve separately from SharePoint.
Please vote for my idea for more connectors

I just spent a couple of hours fighting with a Delve Board, because the document that I wanted to add was not surfacing into Delve. I had two browser tabs open, one with SharePoint Online site and the document open in PowerPoint Online, and one tab with Delve homepage open. But I just could not figure out how to send that document to my Delve Board. ..... until I then realized, that there actually is no such feature yet! I believe it is quite a basic functionality that should be there - just a little button titled "Send to Delve" to force a document show up in Delve homepage or something. ... of course, directly adding a document to specific Delve Board would also be great, but if Microsoft developers are pressed for time, then a poor-man's solution of a simple "Send to Delve" would do just fine for the time being
We definitely need this. Having the ability to pin to boards from Groups is a must. My users are already asking for it.

Absolute requirement this one, as the experience is rather disjointed at the moment. If Delve was added to the document right click menu to tag it to a Delve board, delve could become an excellent workspace.

Yes please! I want to be able to pin things to boards (I understand sharing permissions could be troublesome) from wherever I find them. Seeing a relevant document in a Sharepoint library and then having to stop, find it in Delve, and THEN pit it to a board seems like a needles delay. Especially as individuals harness their own boards and collections they should be able to pin things directly from OneDrive too.

This is important for us too - in fact the whole integration with enterprise technology such as SharePoint etc. so sharing allowing Boards to be a Column in SharePoint, and integrating metadata between applications.

This is a necessary feature to make the content sharing work flow more intuitive for users.Right now the user initiate the sharing would need to start a separate workflow to add contents to boards to make them more discoverable. This extra step would usually lead to no boards being added to.
This one is very important. Reducing the risk of people pulling the incorrect document for a task is a critical need for us.
Would this include the ability in SharePoint to add a "Delve Board" as a column? I know it could get tricky when a document is on multiple boards, but would like that.

header: Allow users to subscribe to blogs

header: Delve profile - better support for custom profile properties/settings
idea_text: I bumped into the new "profile experience" in Delve this week and am not loving the lack of ability to customize. Before the new experience, we added several of our own profile fields such as Certifications, Educational Background, etc, and removed some of the out-of-box properties. This worked fine in the "old" profile, but in the "new" profile, the headers for the OOB properties stay in place when those properties are hidden, creating an empty section. They also relegate the custom properties to an area below the fold of the page. It would be great if we had more administrative control over the profile experience, especially the header sections - hiding fields in the profile is built into the admin UI, we should also be able to hide the headers that they come under as they contain language specific to those properties.

reaction.note: Thanks for your feedback! We like your suggestion and we’re planning to build it.

comments.text: I still can't change my initials on my profile to my full name as I had it before with the "old feature". Everyone in my organization has their full name on profile so it shows on emails, etc. For me all you see is my initials which looks very unprofessional. When could you fix this and have this feature back??? The old version was better than this.

header: Search Everything
idea_text: Search All Office 365 Content from Delve. Currently, mostly only Documents are searched. Enhance search so that all SharePoint content can be found, including lists. Also, Include email from Exchange in my results and all Yammer Content.  Basically, if it's in Office 365, Delve will find it!

reaction.note: Thanks for your feedback! We’re reviewing your suggestion. Remember, the more votes a suggestion gets, the more likely it is that we’ll do it.

E-mail would be big help if we have to prioritize, as would a date range filter.

ALOT
ya because you make a fortnite article about a theory and nobody but your friend can see it suck ALOT

And, when I'm looking for something but I'm not sure if it could find it internally or externally a single search from a single location increases the odds that I'll find something useful.
Interesting

Include Office advanced File Properties please in this search.We often add custom tags in a file so it can be easily referenced in documentation. "Search in Delve for xl20170505pay" for example and it will pull that file up.But it doesn't work with password protected files, information rights management files, etc. because those aren't indexed by Delve - they are encrypted.But we can put those tags in the Advance File Properties which I believe are outside of the encryped information, and could be in the Category or Keywords fields.It would also allow us to put these tags  for all files in a consistent place vs adding a sheet in Excel, or putting itat the bottom of a Word or PowerPoint document.Advanced Properties are great for advanced searching so let Delve search and index those fields.
There needs to be an easier way to search One Drive, SharePoint and Exchange. I also want to know what the latest document is. I think this is perfect for Delve.

And while it's searching the entire software, please make all results interactive! (For instance, keyword searches used to populate with Delve favorite-able tiles, but now the only option is to go to the document)
Make it a choice for the Delve-admin to choose what type that would be able to get searched in Delve.

I would like to be able to find SharePoint sites. Currently if I search for a site, it get back only documents that contain those words. I should be able to search for 'xyz Site' and the search algorithm should prioritise 'sites' over individual documents, libraries or lists. Or I should be able to select Site in the results filter to restrict results. Very often, people need to find a site first because they do not know the exact name of the file they are seeking. Reading through the other comments, it seems to me that the ability to filter or refine the type of result (file, Yammer feed, site, person, list, etc..) is something that is missing with Delve. Thanks.
This should be required feature, from the start of every new feature. Not a bolt on afterthought. (Yammer, Groups, Teams, etc. )

This is a very important concept to be applied to Delve -- one that most users may assume from the start and be frustrated by learning its search limitations (we have already found this to be true in our organization).

If Delve is to replace MySites then it needs to provide the functionality it provided.With a refinable search it could really become a tool that could match people to people who need skills or have interested in learning said skills.   Very powerful.
Make Delve search refinable by content type too. I would like to use Delve to search sites and unified groups.

Hi Matt! Sorry about the delay. We are working on including more content in Delve. As we onboard new content we certainly plan to make it searchable. Including more content can also make search more complex from a user point of view, so we need to take heed in that process and make sure we do not make it more difficult to find things using search. That said - basically, If you can find it in Delve you should also be able to search it. It is a great vision in your last sentence and hope we can move in that direction. Thanks for your input!

header: Editing a board title (including deletion)
idea_text: We should be able to edit the name of the board. What if its created with a typo? ...which leads me to my next point...you should be able to delete a board that is no longer relevant, used, etc.

comments.text: Any News?

"Working on it" since 04012016 
Wow - this must be very complicated.
yeet yeet mother truckers oh and corn hub is a thing
We really need to be able to delete or at least rename boards
Hello, any update on this?
I would echo the comments below.  Hopefully there will be an update on this soon.

Completely agree, boards are a wonderful way of managing the aggregation of content regardless of how they are stored. But without a way to delete or edit miss-spelled boards those of us with varying degrees of OCD are bit annoyed.
Please vote for my idea for more connectors
I love the boards--and my users do as well--but it's nuts that I can't delete the board.

Hello Office365 Feedback Team,Any news on the subject? 
Boards are not something a real company can use if admins are unable to edit typos at the very least....
Did anyone ever get a confirmation from MS on when this will be addressed? I'm at a point where I can not recommend use of various services because they are half-finished - like Boards in Delve.

Thanks for the feedback and it is good to hear that the approach of going towards tags/hashtags makes sense. 
I have some comments to the input from Laimonas
1 & 3etagging all documents is not really possible because that could lead to changing tags that other users have added. We could look into changing tags that you yourself has added, but not tags that others have added. The same goes for deletion. 
4. Having tags as document metadata is something that SharePoint is looking into. Our goal as a platform is to move towards more shared gestures, but unfortunately I can't give you any details on the timeline for this other than that we are working on it.

To start using boards as a serious function and not just for fun, I would expect proper admin Options. As you (admin, post of Feb10 th) write, - this is a tag on doc. Ok, then, I would expect to be able to do some basics:
1. Rename the board, - should lead to retaging all documents tagged with this board automatically
2. Create hierarchy of boards, Group them
3. Delete the board, if there is no doc left that is tagged with it (if there is doc left and I cant Access it, why dont you bring up a message saying EXACTLY this ?-"There are still documents tagged with this board, but you have no Access to them, please contact xyz to remove tags" or similar)
4. Have board assignment as a documents metadata in Sharepoints document library. Whole Office 365 could be integrated platform and not just pieces working on their own. 
Thanks,
Laimonas

I think that the model of thinking of boards as tags makes sense. However, if that's the model, there is functionality not currently part of the board that I feel is very important to making it a useful tool. As a first step, excluding empty boards from suggestions or search results would be great. Because boards are open to everyone across an organization, it would also be great to see trending boards or suggestions for boards when categorizing a document. SharePoint supports @ mentions and # tagging, which is functionality that I feel would strongly improve the "board" concept and the functionality of Delve. Having a board is great, but if I can't see what boards my colleagues are contributing to, then it makes it much harder to find natural collaboration or discover related content.There is also an issue with the search results, as when you search for a board name the search engine does not return documents tagged/added to that board. For example, I have a pdf that I have tagged to a "Corporate" board, but the word "Corporate" does not appear in the document. When I search in Delve for the term "Corporate" this document is not in the results. To me, if a board is going to be a functional tag then it absoutely has to show up in search results as metadata associated with the document. Documents I have added to the board should not only show up in search results, but they should have a higher priority than others. Based on this behavior, it appears that the search functionality does not index the board names/tag. This functionality is clearly available in SharePoint and should aboslutely be implemented in Delve.

Hi. I am a program manager working with boards in Delve. The underlying issue here is that a board i really a collection of documents that share the same tag. If you think of a board as "show me all items tagged 'LasVegasConference' that I have access to" then it follows that the way to make sure there are no documents on a board is to remove/rename the tag on each of the documents shown on a board.  If you no longer want the board to show up for you, what you need to do is to remove it from your favorites. We recently consolidated favorite docs and favorite boards under the star in the left pane, so that is how you can get to all boards you've added docs to or favorited before. 
Perhaps the ask that remains is that you do not want empty boards to show up in suggestions or in search results. This is something we're looking into. Remember though, that if a board looks empty to you, that may be because you happen to not have access to other documents tagged with that board name. 
I would be grateful to hear back as to whether this model of thinking of boards as tags makes more sense to you and helps explain why they behave the way they do today.

I'm pretty much sure Microsoft lack of security is just u able to create a safe secured system to allow deleting from the actual mac addressing, gateway router, sim card a board was created to allow deleting. For more professional server experience giving administrative access to us to clean up the board would provide a professional domain to conduct business.

This is the only reason we haven't deployed Boards. I am astonished and baffled why this isn't a function yet. At the LEAST, boards who have all items removed should disappear. It's been a year and I still can't delete the board I created with a typo even though I am the global admin on our tenet.
Absolutely need to be able to delete boards or rename them. Just want to throw a plus 1 at this.

The inability to delete or (at the very least) rename boards is becoming a critical issue for us. We have hundreds of orphaned boards due to user typos (e.g. 'My Delve Broad'), re-orgs (i.e. renamed departments mean old board names are now wrong), and countless "tests" by users exploring the Delve environment for the first time.
Agree, would also be nice to limit who can create and add to boards.

I agree. Deletion and editing of boards is key to adoption.

I am in total agreement - but feel Management in general of Boards. They should be treated more like Managed Metadata in SharePoint. For instance the ability to associate boards that are similar and seeing an inventory of the boards that are created in Admin Tools.

Editing Board with deletion is expected

header: Please don't replace the period (.) in a username with an underscore (_) when the profile picture file is stored.
idea_text:
There are approximately 3000 or more users who have the same first and last names in our tenant. 
For most of these users, the only difference in the usernames are either a period or an underscore that separates their first and last names.
If the username's period is replaced with an underscore, it will override someone else's profile picture and this is creating a big problem.
Please do not replace the period with an underscore when the photos get stored in the folder User Photos document library.

header: Ability to remove disabled users from Org Charts
idea_text: Currently Delve displays a person on the org chart if they have a valid account and the manager is set.  It gets its data from AD and Azure AD and funnels that through SP Online to get generated.The issue is that newly disabled people are not removed from the org chart.  For instance we mark an employee as disabled, remove their licensing and ensure access is blocked.  Even with this done, a departed employee will display on the org chart.   How Microsoft support suggested to fix it - ManagerID, but for OneDrive Notifications and rights transfers we cannot remove manager id.  Delete the person from Azure AD (o365) - We cannot also immediately delete that person from Azure AD (o365) for the similar reasons including the loss of data from that persons account.We would like the org chart to have the ability to recognize disabled users and or hidden users should not be displayed on the org chart.  This would allow our org chart to be correct all of the time.

reaction.note: We are currently working on automatically removing hidden/disabled users from the org chart.

header: Delve - ADAL Azure Authenticator SSO
idea_text: OneDrive, Work, Excel, and PowerPoint all SSO (Single-Sign On) through the Azure Authenticator app to ADFS or Azure AD. I think this is part of an adaptation of ADAL, but our users LOVE it. The greatest part about this is that our users only have to sign in to one of the apps which then configures the Azure Authenticator app with SSO. I believe this is some form of an ADAL adaptation. I'd recommend speaking with the Office iOS team and the ADAL team about how to implement this. We use MFA in the orgs we support so only having to login once is huge. We also use Conditional Access with required Device Registration so Azure Authenticator is a way to reward users for the upfront hassle of registering their devices. Please implement this for Delve to make it feel more like the rest of the Office family and to increase Delve adoption.

header: Delve のブログから作成した投稿を編集すると、タイトルが [default title] に変更され、保存も公開もできなくなる。編集してもタイトルが [default title] にならずに、保存や公開ができるよう修正してほしい。
idea_text:
一度公開した投稿のタイトル、サブタイトル、記事、画像のどれかを編集し、再度公開しようとすると [default title] と名前が変わってしまい、エラーになってしまいます。エラーメッセージは「この投稿を公開できません。/portals/personal/<ユーザー名>/pPg/default title.pointpub という名前のファイルは既にあります。」と表示されます。保存をクリックしても、「この投稿を保存できません。もう一度お試しください。引き続きこのエラーメッセージが表示される場合は、管理者にお問い合わせください。」というエラーメッセージが表示されます。つまり、保存も公開もできない状態になり、タイトル」が書き換わってしまうため、投稿を削除して作り直すことになります。
作り直せばよいと思うかもしれませんが、この動作が問題を引き起こすことは容易に想像できます。1. 古い投稿で元データが残っていないが、編集しなければならない。
2. 時間をかけて作成した記事に間違いがあり編集する必要がある。
3. タイトルに使った日付が間違っており、編集しなければならない。そのたびに初めから作り直すのでは非効率です。
編集してもタイトルが [default title] にならずに、保存や公開ができるよう修正を望みます。Title:
Editing posts created from Delve's blog changes the title to "default title" and you cannot save or publish it. Please make updates so that this behavior does not occur.Description:
If you edit the title, subtitle, article, or image of the post once published, and try to publish again, the name automatically changes to "default title", which results in an error. The error message says, "We can't publish this post. A file with the name /portals/personal/admin1/pPg/default-title.pointpub already exists. "If you click Save, you will see the error message "We can't save this post. Try again. If you keep getting this error message, contact your admin for help."In other words, you will not be able to save or publish, and the title will be rewritten, so you will need to delete and recreate the post.
You might think it would be better to recreate it, but it's easy to imagine that this behavior causes problems.1. If you need to edit a post which is old and has no original data.
2. There is an error in the article created over time and needs to be edited.
3. The date used for the title is incorrect and must be edited.It is inefficient to recreate from the beginning each time.
I want to modify it so that it can be saved and released without changing the title to [default title].

header: Show custom attributes in Delve IOS Apps
idea_text: Custom attributes added in the User Profile DB. Sync'ed or not are shown under "Additional Information" in the web-based Delve. But Delve for IOS is not showing any of these attributes. That's a huge challenge for any large company wanting to use AAD to store user attributes and Delve to present those attributes on all platforms.

header: Add Office365 Group Member without Email Notification via Graph API
idea_text:
We can use 'resourceBehaviorOptions' to disable the email notification at the creation time of this group via graph api. 
The Group object is required to make the request of creating a new group, but there is no such property that specified the resourceBehaviorOptions in Microsoft.Graph .Net library. When can we expect it to corresponding setting in the .Net library?

header: It would be great to be able and search for exact phrases or have Boolean operators for connecting search elements.
idea_text:
It would be great to be able and search for exact phrases or have Boolean operators for connecting search elements.
Seeing what is currently hot is great but finding what I desperately search for would be at least as nice. Tagging relies too much on active contribution to be reliable.

comments.text: Would love to have given this 3 votes but I only had one vote left. Not sure why Microsoft are so focused on the people search results and ignoring other content types. The main selling point for Delve is that its *meant to* surface everything. Make stuff easier to search then!! I want to find documents with a reference to a person, but I when I search on their full name it recognises the keywords separately and returns results with any reference to the first or last name. Boolean functionality is a must.

header: Outlook prompt for e-mail password change, after reset new password.
idea_text:
Hi,
I would hope that the Delva team can enhance or re-check the windows desktop Ms. Outlook application features.Every time when our e-mail users, wanted to reset the e-mail password, we found out that the Ms. Outlook will not immediately prompt for change new password, even we restarted the Outlook and restarted the PC, the Outlook still sync with the old e-mail password.
Sometimes, it didn't prompt at all, and the worst part is the Outlook show STOP , and NO RESPONDING. Our concern is the change password prompt can be appear immediately, or at least a few minutes.

comments.text: " A contact number would be helpful ". please consider because I am waying all the options and still cannot reset my password.

header: If a user's email address is marked "Hide from address lists", it should be hidden in Delve too.
idea_text: Some users may not want their email address visible to all employees, so Delve should take into account whether or not their address is set to "Hide from address lists" in Exchange.

comments.text:
Peter, you state that "this is currently the behavior for tenants with OnPrem Active Directory with DirSync"We have OnPrem Active Directory with AzureADConnect.  While users set tho "Hide from Address Lists" don't get their own profile page, they continue to appear in their manager's Organiztion.Is the work to hide hidden users from Delve still underway?  If so, will this include hiding them from the Organization hierarchy? 
If it's not still being worked on, count this as a new request :)Martin
any updates?

Hi! We are currently working on fixing it, but then resolve it through hiding these accounts completely from Delve (not only the e-mail address). This is currently the behavior for tenants with OnPrem Active Directory with DirSync, but is currently not supported for tenants without. Br,
Peter (Progam Manager MDCN)

header: Turn on/off "See more related to [user] in Delve" - Onedrive sharing notification
idea_text:
When sharing documents from OneDrive, it would be useful to have control (either on a company-network-wide basis, or as an individual user) as to whether the phrase "See more related to [user] in Delve" appears in the sharing notification email ("[user] has shared '[document]'").
Reason for this is that it may not always be relevant to highlight Delve content to the intended recipient. I would be good to be able to do this without turning off Delve functionality for the user altogether.
As per Q&A here

header: Be able to see whether a person has viewed the email we sent them.
idea_text:
This could be by having a green tick next to the email we have sent them - once they have read it. Also, if they viewed the email, but chose to not reply this should be represented with a red tick next to the email we have sent them. It makes it less frustrating that way. 
This should be for all devices - iOS, Android, Windows etc.

comments.text: Vote people!

header: Delve search from top navigation bar
idea_text: Delve is a great tool for searching for documents across the entire Office 365 suite of applications. Instead of needing to click on the Delve app before gaining access to the search box, it would be great it this search box could be added to the top navigation bar so that a delve search can be easily conducted from any application.

reaction.note: Is it primarily documents that you want access to in the top navigation bar? Delve search also features search for Boards and people.

comments.text:
Most importantly; persons.
I

Agreed.  The ability to have a single enterprise search portal landing page is still important.  Cortana may be headed in the right direction, but an enterprise search landing page will be popular for a while to come.

For me, all I am looking for is documents which might be something you could do initially. But having the ability to search across the entire Office 365 suite of applications would be awesome. I would love to be able to enter a search term and in addition to seeing results for documents with those terms it would be great to see SharePoint sites, Outlook groups, Yammer groups. Having a single search experience right from portal.office.com would be very useful. Many of the users on my tenant have not yet learned to click through to the Delve app to do searches...many of my users struggle to find things when it requires them to navigate before they find what they are looking for. Being able to log into portal.office.com and then type in a search term would be very convenient and helpful to both myself and the other users on my tenant. Please let me know if you need any further feedback.

Thank you, Joshua, for a great suggestion - and thank you for kind words about search in Delve! I totally get that you find search across O365 content practical. Having one search box available for all of the suite is a good vision. There is a general push to realize this, not for Delve search in particular, but for one search box. That said, there is currently no timeline for it. For now we plan to improve on the search experience in Delve first and see how far we can get. We are constantly trying to add content into the Delve experience and we do aim to have all content in Delve searchable.  Great idea and very sorry for the delay, btw.

header: The way Delve displays documents 'titles'
idea_text: A document in Delve does not display its name. Instead it displays its 'title' - which is based on the formatting of words within the document. I appreciate the ability of Delve to search for terms within the document, however the document name is right up there with the most important things to display on search returns. I have loads of documents with similar words within them, but they are named very different things. It is very hard to find the document I am looking for specifically, as the document name (something I have purposefully chosen to reflect that specific document) is not shown.

comments.text: I can't believe more people haven't voted for this.  When I search content in Delve, I see a whole bunch of documents with title of Short Document Template.  I have to click on each one to see what the Word document is actually about!

header: Ability to disable the "Message", "Call" and "Email" buttons on the about me profile page
idea_text: All three of these buttons are problematic in that they invoke external applications:  Lync/SfB, Default OS UC Client, and Outlook respectively.  With browsers increasingly securing these sorts of callouts the buttons are problematic and induce a lot of scary security dialogs on first click.  Not a great experience.Further - for customers that are not 100% Softphone or Lync Voice shops - the "Call" button is 100% useless.  We need the ability to disable these in our tenant as the user experience is problematic for all but 100% Microsoft OS, Microsoft Voice shops.  Either that or the Delve team should target these buttons to invoke a native web browser app or site to offer these services.   Callout to external app is WAY too fragile.

reaction.note: The buttons have already been changed, and there are mor changes coming that will improve this experience.

comments.text: These buttons have removed and changed, due to feedback and changes in the product.Hope more end-users and tenant admins will be happy with that change.
I had seen these buttons in our tenant but have now gone? How do these buttons appear? Is there a requirement for these to appear?

header: Connector for Delve to be able to access Dropbox cloud storage accounts
idea_text:
Delve is a fantastic way of keeping track of documents that are being shared and worked on throughout the O365 environment (OneDrive and SharePoint).
My organisation has recently purchased a an enterprise licence for Dropbox.  It would be great if there was a connector that enabled Delve to show, search and share documents in third party cloud storage apps like Dropbox to streamline the user experience.

header: Less on discovery of documents, more on profile and search
idea_text: Our users tell us there is less value in discovering other people's work and documents in Delve and more value in finding people's skills, where they fit in the organization and the ability to interact with them.Our suggestion is to create an layout and UI with less emphasis on documents and more emphasis on profile information.

comments.text: A result page focussed on people (using the card layout) would be great! Currently the profiles are richer in Delve than SP so I want to use these as the click destination, but the people search in Delve is far from prominent of the left hand navigation.

header: Show other user's time zone along with mine when checking out their Delve profile
idea_text: Show other user's time zone instead of mine when checking out their Delve profile.As a worldwide organization, it is frequent that I check out a user's Delve profile for someone on the other side of the globe.I love the idea of getting a quick glance at their availability, but it may be misleading to see someone 'Free' at 10 am when it might in fact be the middle of the night for them over there.While it might be obvious to most users that people in other parts of the world work at different times, I think having two "timelines" instead of one when looking at a user in a different time zone would go a long way to make it easier to coordinate the best time to organize a meeting or find other opportunities to communicate.

header: Provide JavaScript tracking snippet to collect signals from (LOB) web applications outside O365
idea_text: The Office Graph API allows signals from external systems to be sent to Delve, ref. Salesforce integration example  However, this requires code changes to the external applications.This idea is to have a JavaScript tracking snippet (e.g. signals.js) that can easily be added to line of business (LOB) web applications. The framework should track and parse user actions - view item, open link, search queries, etc. - and send these actions as signals to the Office Graph. This will extend the Office Graph into the corporate landscape.This is similar to how Google Analytics collect user data by adding the analytics.js JavaScript tracking snippet to measure web site usage, ref.

header: Add People View to Delve Profile Page - Populate All Emails from User
idea_text: At one time, Outlook had a feature called People View, which populated all of the emails from a particular contact. It would be useful to combine this feature with a contact's Delve Profile Page.This may also mean that Delve Profile Pages would need to be created for contacts that are not in your network, and for which you may only have their name and email address. Even if that contact does not have access to your network, providing a non-network contact a Delve Profile Page could allow your network to keep up with that contact, especially if that contact is a client.For example, your network could have an important client, and allowing a Profile page could allow your network to keep up with how everyone else in the network is interacting with the client. When was the last time someone talked to them? What is the last document that some was working on for that client? What is the last email that came in from that client?Many thanks.

header: Allow individuals to pin important documents to their profile
idea_text: I'm a new employee and part of my onboarding process is to absorb the great work my co-workers have already completed. This process would be made much easier if I could quickly access my co-workers' best and most important work quickly, rather than digging through their Delve profile to find a needle in a haystack. If we could all just pin or flag our best docs so that they appear at the top of our Delve profiles, I would save tons of time. If I can't find relevant docs in Delve, usually I set up an in-person meeting, which of course is inefficient and takes up valuable focus time for me and the person I'm meeting with.

header: Provide an analytics API for search, blog, and user profile metrics
idea_text: We'd like to see a Delve API similar to the Exchange API that allows querying of user interactions with Delve search (e.g. popular search terms, searches per day, searches by user, abandoned searches, etc), blog (blog entries for a user, blog articles read, etc), and user profiles (last update, has photo, has contact details, etc).  This will be helpful for among other things helping to understand usage and adoption patterns around Delve services.

comments.text: We would take an ability to inject scripting into the delve UI (we already have a web analytics product that can take an event stream, but it can't hook into delve)

<tenantname/workloadname>.sharepoint.com
THE NAME OF THE FILE SHARED people can click (link)(4ksamples.com)

<tenantname/workloadname>.sharepoint.com

header: Delve blog poor edit experience

header: expose personal onedrive (and other sources) to Delve and the Graph
idea_text: I think that it would be useful to provide the ability for users who may only recently have started with O365 at work, or recently joined a company that uses it, to selectively expose personal (meaning not provided by their employer) sources of information to Delve to help populate the Graph for them and let them get started quicker in finding things related to their interests at work/their new employer. header: Accessibility - Preferred Contact Method
idea_text:
It would be great if users in Delve could specify a preferred contact method which would be visible to others in Delve, and possibly on the contact card.
Many people have accessibility requirements which mean that, for example, telephone calls are either not possible, or cause a significant level of anxiety. Allowing users to specify a preferred contact method would make users with accessibility requirements more comfortable. 
Some examples would be; email, IM, voice call, video call, face to face, sign language etc..

header: The Profile/Home page improvement
idea_text:
1) The section "Click a person to see what they’re working on" is unnecessary. As the organization chart is anyhow displayed, one can click on a person to know more about the work the person is working on.
The section should be used to display the visited/edited sharepoint sites.  This will minimize outside bookmarks. 
2) Since within an organization, profile pictures of employee are with the admin, the actual profile pictures can be displayed in the organization chart to help identify people better. [Please note that the user can have a customized image for Profile image which can appear in the homepage but not in organization chart]
3) The Share option can be improved to display the mailing lists that the user is a member of. This will reduce the complexity in typing necessary mailing addresses.
4) The no of people who have read a blog post can be displayed at the top or under notifications. Also, when a post is published, rather than allowing the author to choose the audience, by default share it with the common organization blog. This way it is easy.
5) In the homepage, instead of showing poular documents on a wide organization level, categorize general and specific [ user's organization hierarchy] poular documents.

header: Forgot password link redirection
idea_text: We have disabled the ability for users to change or reset passwords within our Office 365 tenant in favor of an internal tool set.  Now when a user of our tenant attempts to use the forgot password link they are taken to a page that infers the password functionality does not work do to a licensing issue which is not correct in our case.  This has created some confusion for our staff and students generating multiple tickets.   Please consider providing administrators the ability to customize the target URL of the forgot password link for domains registered within their tenants.   You appear to have the foundation in place to delivery this functionality already, please take it a few steps further.

header: Customizable Team Feed
idea_text: I work on a large team of people geographically dispersed around the globe.  What's more is that we're not a coherent team - we more or less act as separate teams.  This has led to communication problems.  One example is that some of us in the US were working to solve the same problem as some of our colleagues in China without even knowing it until much effort had been duplicated.  Something like Delve could fix this.  Here's the idea - the ability to create and publish access to "custom" feeds.  For example, we would like the ability to create a "Global IT Team" feed and grant access using Active Directory security control.  That way, for example, we could just grant read/write to the feed to one security group and anyone in that group could make new posts and read the posts that are there.  What would be really great is if there could be a Delve client that could largely automate post creation.  I envision this working by right-clicking on the root of a shared project folder that contains a readme file with a specific name and format and an image with a specific name and then clicking "add to Delve", then the Delve client would automatically scan the files to create the post and scan the share permissions to automatically determine who will see the post on their feed.  That way, oh - someone is working on this awesome C# application to do XYZ thing and it's not a secret - this can let other people who might be interested in contributing know about it. You're working on a semi-private project? No problem. Access is automatically restricted based on share permissions so if you didn't grant access to someone, it won't ever show up on their Delve feed.I envision the feed posts being much like those of the Edge Browser feed - a single image (optional), a category & tags which are clickable for filtering, and a brief summary.  The title would be hyperlinked to open either the project readme file that contains more info, the entire shared folder, or even an actual web page if one exists for the project.

header: Bug Fix  - Right Clicking performs a Left Click periodically - Ver 1808
idea_text:
With Office 365 Business (2016) Subscription, Right Clicking in Office Products (Word & Outlook tested) performs a Left Click periodically. Does not happen in any other program. (IE, Edge, Chrome, Adobe Reader, Notepad++) Happening to multiple users on multiple computers with different hardware and mice. Also happens on my personal non domain laptop, using my Home O365 subscription. I was at 2013 and it was fine. I upgraded to the newest version (O365 Ver 1808 Build 10730.20102) and it started doing it. Only thing common is Office 365 version 1808 - Builds 10730.20127 & 10730.20102.
I have done 2 days of troubleshooting, everything from Online Office repairs, reinstalled Office, different mice and user profiles, and it even happen in safe mode. All updates are done and sfc /scannow ran 3 times and the problem still persists. Again, this is occurring on about 10 systems and the only thing in common is Office 365 Ver 1808.
I contacted O365 Support. They are pretty much useless so I thought I’d try my luck here.

header: Add the ability to access Delve from File Explorer
idea_text:
For me, Delve is like window's File Explorer but for the content that was shared with me. As a user, it is only natural to have the ability to search for content in one central place no matter if you created it or someone else shared it with you. Currently, you search for the content you created (or saved) in File Explorer and "shared with you content" on a completely different environment - Delve.
It will be very useful to integrate them. Access Delve from file explorer, or even better, replacing file explorer with Delve

header: Ability to add either pre-made or custom badges/photo frames to contact cards.
idea_text: I would like to see the ability to assign badges to contact cards in outlook. The purpose is for a company to be able to recogonize top performers, SMEs, or other areas of recognition that we wish to be seen publicly internally and/or externally. Another option could be to offer photo frames such as in Facebook. The ability to customize these frames/badges by uploading our own images would be ideal. One thing we would want to keep in mind is restricting the ability for people to add their own badges, perhaps have it be permission based or admin based to keep the badges valid.

header: Improve "Did you know" wording in My Analytics
idea_text: In the My Analytics weekly report page, there are "Did you know" tips above each of the graphs. It appears that the Did You Know verbiage is displaying an overall trend rather than a unique insight to that week. For example, if I read email afterhours consistently, it will say, "Did you know...you read primarily read email afterhours" even though I corrected that trend and had no afterhour activity or had only had meetings afterhours that week. This can be confusing to users, especially if the graph for that week doesnt match the Did You Know. I suggest fixing the verbage to something like, "Overall Trend" to help avoid confusion betwen the data and the text.

header: Oversharing Reporting
idea_text: Provide a mechanism to report oversharing of information, An "I Shouldn't Be Seeing This!" visual queue on each search hit, similar to "inappropriate content" reporting mechanisms in social media. Make it easy. One click. Capture the reporter and content and alert site owners so that they can take action. May be as simple as a dedicated list or area much like access requests. We stress good data stewardship and security but still mistakes are made. Search is a powerful tool and the most likely means of finding content with loose security. This capability as described, that could be switched on or off as a global search setting, will help organizations find these mistakes and take action.

header: OOS integration
idea_text: In a SharePoint hybrid scenario the user experience is degraded if a document resides in an on-prem farm. Preview does not work and editing in word online etc cannot be achieved. With addition of OOS on prem the experience still does not improve in a hybrid context. The user still has to click through to the on-prem SharePoint instance before being able to use the OOS features. Since we are really talking about a URL here it should be possible to add your on prem OOS server url to the tenant and because of the way Hybrid search work by uploading the index to the tennant; that seems very to treat all the files in that index differently and apply the correct URL decoration to allow seamless click through from delve to the on-prem WOPI iframe and possibly address preview issues. Thus creating a massive business benefit for very little effort at the o365 end.

header: Implement Technical Networking Tool Association With Leading Providers...  An example would be 'SLACK' (https://slack.com/signin) linkage.
idea_text: Implement Technical Networking Tool Association With Leading Providers...  An example would be 'SLACK' () linkage.  Whereas Microsoft beats any other competitor in whatever field it may compete, it sometimes lacks in the operability for developers/coders/programmers to associated with one another through the equivalent of 'social medium' platforms but instead direct to the point.I created a 'Slack' account hoping to group some coders in the States that I know (who work in reputed companies), and 'Slack' is truly amazing with all its bots, 90's-like MIRC operability, and add-ons that Microsoft may not provide due to intellectual copyrights.  And then there is GitHub/Git-Shell, and countless other networking options by professionals (I am not going to list them all because I do not know them all).I just think that Office 365 should have some sort of association with these mediums to further enhance the Microsoft name, in a way making it domineer further, and at the same time encourage diversification and entrepreneurial intellectual incentive.  For example, it would be nice to share a Delve/Sway post directly to a 'Slack' channel room and allow it so all other members can edit the work directly through 'Slack', or indeed include additional tools in the Sway that only Slack may provide.Office 365 could catalogue a 'White Pages Directory' (however online) of all associated 'Slack' groups/channels for view within Office 365 (if consented by the other side/individual), and there is room for partnership and integration between these software companies.That is just one example.  I hope on hearing back.NemesisC64

reaction.note:
Hi, thanks for your feedback. If you see Delve in a different language than what you want, you can go to your profile page in Delve and change the language from there:In Delve, on your profile page, click Update profile.
Click the link under “How can I change language and regional settings?”
On the Edit details page, click the ellipsis (…) and then choose Language and region.
Set your Language preferences.
Click Save all and close.Hope this works!

header: Content cards are now displayed differently on different Delve pages - please harmonize!
idea_text: I just noticed that the exact same documents are displayed with conflicting titles depending on what page you're visiting in Delve. If you're on the homepage, it seems that content cards display the Word document's filename as title, but if you're on a Board page, the exact same content card actually gets the document's title from within the document content itself. This is very confusing, because the same content card should be displayed 1:1 with the same display template, regardless of what page you're visiting. Now the content cards on board pages are conflicting with home and search pages. At this stage, it really doesn't matter if you want to choose to always display Filename or if you want to choose to always display Title from some metadata, etc etc. But once you do choose something, please use that same display template constantly through whole Delve, all pages. Now it is just confusing :)

header: Delve Blurry Profile Picture (When Exchange Online is Not Enabled)
idea_text:
When EXO is not enabled within the organization, user profile picture gets pixelated within Delve. Reason:
1. Delve will try to fetch the image from MSGraph, which inturn first tries the mailbox in EXO.
2. Since there is no mailbox in EXO, MSGraph will reach out to AAD to fetch the image.
	a. This would be the image most recently updated by either the user or the tenant admin.
	b. If that also fails, the MSGraph will return a failure to Delve, which then will try to fallback to SharePoint and fetch the image.
3. If there is an image in AAD, it is fetched from there.
4. Because AAD has restrictions on the size of image files, MSGraph will get a low resolution picture from AAD which are going normally to be blurry in Delve (Picture size is reduced while fecting)The Idea I am suggesting is, if there is no Exchange Mailbox/no picture in Exchange, look at SharePoint as an alternative source location for profile picture.  This way the EXO dependency will be removed and provides a better picture experience, plus the SharePoint image and the Delve image will be the same.

header: Have Delve search for and index Advanced File Properties
idea_text: We often add custom tags in a file so it can be easily referenced in documentation. "Search in Delve for xl20170505pay" for example and it will pull that file up.But it doesn't work with password protected files, information rights management files, etc. because those aren't indexed by Delve - they are encrypted.But we can put those tags in the Advance File Properties which I believe are outside of the encryped information, and could be in the Category or Keywords fields.It would also allow us to put these tags  for all files in a consistent place vs adding a sheet in Excel, or putting itat the bottom of a Word or PowerPoint document.Advanced Properties are great for advanced searching so let Delve search and index those fields.

header: Allow us to configure which documents are highlighted in the People Experience
idea_text: 'About Me' page used to point to My Sites and we were able to link to specific documents that a user would want to see about a person. Now that 'About Me' points to Delve, we are presented with random documents related to the user, with the most recent on top. Can we use search criteria to make sure we pick the documents that are relevant?

reaction.note:
Thanks for spending time sharing your thoughts!
We’ve been thinking about allowing end-users to “pin” documents on their pages. Would that be of interest?
Or are you after an admin control that lets you control the query that selects documents to show on all users’ profiles?

comments.text: I would also love to see Delve allow you to pin entire folders to aboard. In the education sector I have thirty students in each period sharing a folder with me. I would like to be able to create a board for the period and pin each students shared folder to that board for easy access.

Instead of the contact pinning or the administrator pinning a document, could the user viewing a Profile pin specific documents for that contact, which only the user would see. For example, I could pin a document on your profile that only I could see. So if I am working with you on a project, I could visit your Profile and see all of the documents that I think are relevant. It would be like my own private folder/board for that contact.

Hi, thanks for looking at my suggestion. Just pinning relies on the users taking the action to pin their documents. I would like an admin control that would allow us to control a query on all profiles to find and show specific documents based on search criteria. We used to have a script on the 'About me' page (pre-Delve) that looked for documents containing the name of the person whose profile you were on and that had a specific property in one of the document property fields. We would like to recreate this.

header: Consolidating Notifications
idea_text:
As O365 uses SSO across Exchange, Yammer, Calendar, so on.. it iwuld be great if a centralised notification system was built out and updates in any of these individual systems are pushed out through Notifications. 
e.g if i'm logged into Outlook, or skype, i should still receive a notification that originated in Yammer. So a Notification Hub that is common across all of your products. It is how Iphone, windows phone or android notifications work, all the apps in the ecosystem push to a hub and the user has options in settings to manage preferences.

comments.text:
+1000
The notifications "bell" in the upper-right seems to consolidate some services, but not others, and, of course, only works if you have a browser open to O365. What's needed is a consolidated notification function that works in all desktop/mobile apps as well as the browser, and covers Exchange, Teams, Yammer, SPO, etc.--anything that can alert or notify.
i guess this is how things work on W10

header: Hide entire content sources from Delve (cloud hybrid search scenario)
idea_text: In a cloud hybrid search scenario, content from on-premises sources also appear in Delve searches. We are aware of the fact that single documents can be hidden from Delve by adding a HideFromDelve column in the content source. For large content sources (>100000 items), however, it would be beneficial if the Office 365 global admin could add a filter that will hide the entire content source from Delve. This would be similar to adding -isExternalContent:1 in the Search Center.

header: contact info in the delve mobile app

reaction.note: Hi, we’ve updated the Android app (and will soon update the iOS app) with the ability to email people from profile pages. Could you tell us more about what you might be looking for? Thanks!

comments.text: Artificial intelligence (AI) is all about computers taking our data and giving us suggestions, reminders, and tips to make us more productive. Delve and/or Cortana should be able to look at our contact list and surface people who are important to us, because we have a meeting with them that day or we haven't contacted them and they are a top customer. The data to make this happen could be collected from the number of email messages or calander dates we have with them, or additional information manually entered by the user. For example, how often the person should be contacted, how important the person is (1 - 100 scale), how many notes / phone calls are entered for the person (this is another feature the must be added - see LinkedIn Relationship tools or lightweight CRM Cloze). There is also a way to connect your cell phone history and data.

header: New hyperlinks get removed from Delve blogs
idea_text:
This is  a bug that the Delve Product group should fix.. 
SharePoint Online - Delve
When adding a hyperlink to text in Delve blogs, they are not saved as expected. Once you click "save" the text (you add the hyperlink to) remains on the page, but the hyperlink that was added gets removed. Steps to repro: 
- Sign into 
- click the Delve tile to open Delve 
- Click "Me" in the left quick launch pane
- Click +New Post in the Blog section of page and create a new blog post titled BlogPost1 and add some text to the post 
- Save and publish BlogPost1
- Now navigate to BlogPost1 in the Browser and copy the URL of BlogPost1
The URL should be similar to the one here.. 

- Navigate back to Delve and Click +New Post in the Blog section of the ME page again and create another new blog post titled BlogPost2
- In BlogPost2, add some text, then highlight the text and add hyperlink to BlogPost1 
- Notice the Text now appears in blue as hyperlinked text normally does
- Now click "Save" and the hyperlink you added to the text will get removed

comments.text: I've seen MS do some dumb things and miss some big things, but this is CRAZY. Blog functionality is USELESS if you can't hyperlink! *smh*
I have this problem too. It's massive - how can you blog if you can't link? How on earth did MS ship a blogging tool which removed links?

header: Show Websites I'm following on Delve
idea_text: Show Websites I'm following on Delve.

reaction.note:
Great feedback! I’d love to understand more about where and why you’d want this. 
Is it on your own site to get quicker access to the sites you’re following? 
Or is it on other people’s pages to understand what they’re interested in? 
Or perhaps both?

comments.text: Our communities of practice use Sharepoint sites as the focus for their activities across a variety of other platforms. Site followers should be a key indicator for our communities of membership; however, we've no way to access the list of members as Sharepoint hides it. Can this be made accessible to Power BI somehow?

At some point, I "followed" a site in O365 SharePoint.  The site was deleted or moved or something, but now there are links to the site in Word that go nowhere.  Clicking on my profile in SharePoint opens Delve, and there does not appear to be a way to see, or remove these links.

As an individual : 
1) There is some site I could access "everyone except external" but on which I not "member" as individual (Public Site)
2) There is some site on which I am member (individual access by other security group or nominative access as Visitors, Members, Owners,, ...) but I not necessarly "following" the site.
3) There is some site I am following (even I not member like 1) or on which I am member like 2)So from my perspective a user have different "list" of site : 
* Site he can access
* Site he can access & member
* Site he can access & following
* Site we are recommending to users (based on some algorithm)

I can comment on that.  I want to be able to pick out websites within my institution and when I click the favorite star on those sites, they also show up in my favorites on Delve.  This is not a feature right now and it seems counter-intuitive since it can be done for documents.

header: Ability to share Blog Pages easily

comments.text: Nice thought, Stephen Booth.

I think Teams would be a very good place to share Blog posts.  For example, i attend a lot of after work events run by professional bodies such as Internaltional Institute of Business Analysis, British Computer Society and Institute of Engineering and Technology.  I then type up my notes in a Blog post.  As these are usually quite general the graph is not very likley to flag them to my collegaues as the keyword density is low.  Whilst I can currently share via email this misses the referabiliy longevity of Teams where someone who later joins the team can see what has been done before, it also risks the notification being lost in the flood of other emails.  An additional value is that sharing something to Teams tells the graph "I think that this is something that people on this team might be interested in" so if they do click on and read it that re-infores that and highlights that other people who later join that team may also be interested.
