header: Add search scopes to Delve search
idea_text: Add search scopes to delve search.

reaction.note: Hi, thanks for the suggestion! We need a little more information to determine this: what kind of scope do you mean? From your comment, Cory, it seems like you are talking about refiners/filters on people search. Is that correct?

comments.text: This is critical. Delve is next to useless to us as it returns so much. If I search for "standard cost" I get thousands of hits, but I am only interested where it is referenced in  OneNote for example, but there is no way to tell Delve to just return that info is in OneNote, not the hundreds of excel and pdf files out there.

This feature would be very helpful. Searching people via interests or skills would be very helpful for my purposes. It would be even more helpful if this search can be restricted to a specific collaboration group.
yes

I agree that it would be great to have a more powerful search in Delve.  We too are trying to encourage the use of Delve to find and organize documents across site collections.  Delve boards are very useful, but users must first find the documents in Delve.  Being able to add documents to Delve favorites and boards from SharePoint would also be very helpful.  Either way, users just need to be able to easily find and organize documents and with the modern views excluding the "follow" feature, Delve seems what we should be encouraging.  It's just not easy right now to reliably find content in Delve.

Both Delve and SharePoint people search need to support custom user profile properties. At present you can configure them, populate them, refine with them, but not search. We could do it on prem with SharePoint so for some customers its a step backwards and a real issue.
Filters by dates (created date, edited date), file types, sizes, general location (in a SHarepoint site, Microsoft Team, Email, Outlook Group Message), Team Conversation, etc.

I would love to be able to search just like Google. For example:If I want to find all PDFs containing the phrase "new hire" on the "Global HR" SharePoint site I would love to be able to type in a simple search query like the following:"New Hire" -filetype:pdf -site:"Global HR"Even the basic ability to search phrases using quotes would be a good improvement though.

I agree, you need some options to pre configure some search results, filtering om specific data. Like you have in SharePoint Online. We are pushing our customers to find there documents through Delve, instead of browsing through SharePoint libraries and folders. Also simple operators like AND and OR should be possible in search for Delve
What kinds of scopes would you like to see?Jere, it sounds like you are talking about search for people, correct?Sorry for the delay, btw!
It would be good to scope search to specific items like Skills, Projects or Office location.

There is no need for everything - particularly profile background images to be corporately branded. We are all people with personalities, not automatons, and should be allowed within reason to express some personal choice.

Need to allow end user to upload, virus scanned, images within specific parameters.  This can easily be accomplished via an image editing tool i.e., MS Paint. Provide a less than 300 word document as a README.  Thank you.
Company branding would be excellent

Thanks for the feedback! This was implemented with the focus of allowing users to personalize their profile background, not with a whole-company branding focus. Your feedback is great , though, and we'll take it into account when discussing next steps for this feature.
Would be better to have no picture, than one that isn't relevant to the organization or the user.

This was a "notebook" not too long ago in my company - like just last week - I logged in today and saw tropical mountains... not related to anything at all - and we can't even customize it or choose from company approved designs. 
Can you at least let the admins choose from "approved" designs? Or upload "approved" designs?
How are we expected to utilize this at-work-pseudo-social-network if we can't do more with it?

header: Ability to remove some documents from Delve
idea_text:
Hi,
Sometimes, some document do not need to be on delve (archive, old versions ...) it would be good to be able to remove them when we are the author of the document.

comments.text: I just relized that EVERY email attachment in Outlook365 is visible in delve for the whole company. This is insane. It also shows private HR-documents! How can I stop this???

Apologies if I've misunderstood or I'm just posting way after MS have fixed this but can't you just click on the same button you use to add a document to a board and then tick the X on the Board you want the document removed from?

also for very sensitive data (prevent over shoulder looking) this is needed. else you can only look at delve when in a secure environment as something e.g. a employee salary negotiation is visible with just enough info in the summary to be "unsafe"

What in the world were the developers thinking to leave out the ability for end users to either assign 'private' to some of their files, or toggle the Recent Documents feature on or off?  It is just beyond my understanding, especially in today's world.

I am brand new to Office 365.  I now have many of the same document in Delve as a result of some testing and trying to work out the various accounts and emails etc. that I seem to have set up.  Now I have the beginning of a mess in each and am shocked to learn here there is no way to delete ... clean up.  Someone(s) at Microsoft is/are just not "thinking".  if it is me, let me know because I cannot understand why delete would not be an option.
It is absolutely ridiculous that you can't remove a document from delve.

Seriously there should be a way to delete. Not everything uploaded is on purpose. i accidentally uploaded a picture onto delve and now there is no way to delete it. I am so frustrated i'm thisclose to switching to Apple.
There MUST be a way to delete (permanently) documents with old/out-of-date/incorrect/personal information. It's UK law for the latter!
Documents can be hidden from Delve:

One of my documents in Delve has personal information on it and I would like to be able to permanently delete it. It is upsetting that I can't. Not sure I will be using the online Office much as a result of this bad feature.

header: Ability to Add Link Back to SharePoint Site in Delve Page
idea_text: When users come to the Delve site from our SP site, it is cumbersome for them to get back to the SP site. This is a deterrent to users adopting Delve. Can we add a way to add a link back to the site -- either in the left nav or in the profile banner?

reaction.note: Can you elaborate more about the concrete problem to navigate back to the SP Site? The browser’s back button should work (except for the case  when a redirect flow is being triggered). Thanks for the feedback.

comments.text:
Hi Delve Team, There is no option for redirecting to users sharepoint site from Delve.
As you said Browsers back button is working. but how many times user can click? Please add a button or any redirecting link to sharepoint from Delve.
I want to give my users a clear and consistent way to navigate between Delve and SharePoint,you give us a 'Global Navigation' like SharePoint and then we can add the links critical links we need.

I want to save my favourite sharepoint links in my delve favourites area... There are too many sharepoint sites I'm following to look under sharepoint.. I just want my top 3 most important SharePoint sites on my delve page. If delve is my personal portal/dashboard then surely it should store links not just document?
You can configure your company logo in the Office 365 top bar to go to your SharePoint site. This provides an easy way back to your SharePoint site from anywhere in Office 365.

You aren't always going "back" to a SP site.  For instance, I want to add a "favorite" document to Delve that is on a SP site and not in OneDrive.  It's a pain to have to open up SP, find the document, and do it all over again if I need it later on.  why not have the ability to see all of your "fav" documents in one place?  Only providing access to certain docs defeats the purpose.

We have the same request, many users find it confusing how they get back to SharePoint after reaching Delve. The ability to add some navigation items to everyone's Delve page would be great. Delve currently has left hand side navigation similar to the Current Navigation in SharePoint.Give us the ability to add 'Organisation Links' or something in this left hand side section.
Guess it would need to be a tenant setting and therefore accessible in the O365 Admin area only which I think would be fine.
We get a grumpy looking tiger image when we hit the back and a "Something went wrong :( " message - it takes us entirely out of our tenant. No one will want to go to Delve.

We have the same issue. The only Office 365 service my company is using now and for the foreseeable future is SharePoint. Delve takes users out of SharePoint and we'd like the ability to insert links back to our intranet homepage as well as being able to promote other links on our intranet through Delve.
just figured out that the 'pin to app launcher' feature is only working in Internet Explorer (possibly Edge, haven't tried that) but not Chrome. Frustrating user experience.

hello O365 feedback team - I have the same question ! I don't think that using the back button is ideal really? users would expect a button or a link somewhere on the page to help them to get back to where they were, or at least a consistent navigation from the rest of O365. If a user has performed a couple of actions within Delve (eg click on a couple of different profiles, boards etc they will have to perform multiple back clicks to get back to their SharePoint Online site. 
I've tried setting a custom tile in O365 admin - that involves 3 clicks (open the App launcher, click on my apps, click on custom tile) as Delve App launcher behaves differently to within OWA or SharePoint Online (where the Custom tiles can be added straight to App launcher, so you're down to 2 clicks (App launcher button, Custom tile) but still not ideal? 
I also tried setting up a custom theme in O365 admin (that allows you to add a button with a link to the suite bar) - but this doesn't appear in Delve! 
As Heather says, it's hard to get people to adopt or even like Delve when the experience is frustrating. We feel like you can get to Delve from a few places (links on SharePoint sites, your own profile links) but you can't get out of Delve that easily. 
please can you advise when this might be added to roadmap?

header: Extend Delve beyond Microsoft using connectors
idea_text: Currently, we use an enterprise search tool from a different vendor that indexes content from Sharepoint, Wordpress, Salesforce and Github. This unified search is nice, but the results are not as useful as what Delve provides.Similar to the connectors feature provided in Teams, Delve should support third party (and custom) connectors that allows it to ingest contents from other popular tools. This should also allow for the ability to build custom connectors that developers can use to integrate content from custom sources into Delve.

comments.text: One needs to be able to include other content that resides on-premises. The old ability of aggregating the user profile via BDC was very valuable. It would be nice to integrate that profile data into a board in Delve. For our specific scenario, the database could be moved to Azure if that would help overcome any obstacles.

MSFT provides a 'cloud search service application' which runs on Sharepoint server.  It crawls external content sources and sends the index files to O365 so they can be searched from Delve and/or SPO.  3rd party connectors are available.
See my earlier comment.  It would be great to extend Delve to LinkedIn and other sources as suggested above.

header: Provide easier discovery and rollup for blogs
idea_text: Currently there is no way to easily discover other users' blogs, not is there a way to cleanly and neatly rollup blogs from all users. Without this, it offers no clear advantage over the older SharePoint based blogs. Currently, I have to hack my way using a CSWP with custom display templates and that is too clumsy and doesn't work most of the times.

comments.text: Absolutely must have. In my team we need an aggregated blog to inform the team about latest news.
Agreed; it would be great in a large company to see who has actually posted blogs other than searching each person's profile page one-by-one.
Exactly Anonymous has the right idea!
I agree. What is the point of a blog and interaction if there is no way to discover the blogs??

You can create as many custom attributes as you want and write some CSOM code to directly import to these but it's tiresome and long winded. We want the simple solution of creating a custom prop, then mapping to any AD field we want. Until then Delve people profiles are a waste of time imo.

Hyperlinks could then include placeholder values that are replaced  at run-time by other User Profile properties. e.g. a link like "/searchresults.aspx?ContentType=EmployeeProfile&Name={EmployeeName} would turn into a link to search results page about the curretnly view profile.Looking forward to some new features in Delve, it does have potential.
